error.signature: java.io.IOException: The workspace is already in use by another build

verdict.summary: Jenkins cannot start a build because the workspace directory is locked by another running or stuck build. Concurrent builds of the same job compete for the same workspace directory.

dead_ends.action: Manually delete the workspace directory while a build is running
dead_ends.why_fails: Deleting the workspace of a running build causes that build to fail mid-execution with file-not-found errors

dead_ends.action: Kill all Java processes on the agent to release locks
dead_ends.why_fails: Killing the agent process disconnects it from Jenkins, orphans child processes, and may corrupt build state

workarounds.action: Enable custom workspace paths or use workspace cleanup plugin
workarounds.how: Add 'customWorkspace "${WORKSPACE}-${BUILD_NUMBER}"' in the pipeline agent block to give each build its own workspace, or use the Workspace Cleanup plugin to clean up before each build

workarounds.action: Configure concurrent builds with separate workspaces using the throttle-concurrents plugin
workarounds.how: Install the Throttle Concurrent Builds plugin, configure a throttle category, and set maximum concurrent builds. Jenkins will automatically create workspace@2, workspace@3, etc. for concurrent runs

leads_to.condition: When locked workspaces consume all disk space, causing the agent to become unhealthy and disconnect

preceded_by.condition: When agent reconnects after a disruption while a build was running, leaving stale locks

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Workspace locked is a runtime resource contention issue; pipeline syntax is a parsing error before execution
